meanings.definition: A person who goes without something desired or necessary.
meanings.sent1: The forgoers of sweets chose to eat fruits instead.
meanings.sent2: The forgoers of coffee decided to drink herbal tea instead.
meanings.sent3: The forgoers of cake made a healthy choice by having a fruit salad.
meanings.sent4: The forgoers of shopping found joy in saving money for a vacation.
meanings.sent5: The forgoers of dessert were rewarded with improved health.

meanings.definition: Those who abstain or refrain from something.
meanings.sent1: The forgoers of alcohol opted for sparkling water at the party.
meanings.sent2: The forgoers of gossip avoided negative conversations.
meanings.sent3: The forgoers of social media found peace in disconnecting.
meanings.sent4: The forgoers of TV shows focused on reading books instead.
meanings.sent5: The forgoers of fast food embraced home-cooked meals for better health.
